properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 2 at 11:02PM HST until March 3 at 2:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
The island of Maui in Maui County

* Until 200 AM HST.

* At 1058 PM HST, radar indicated an area of nearly stationary heavy
rainfall from Hana to Kipahulu and Oheo Gulch. Rain was falling at
a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour for the past four hours. Total
rainfall amounts over the area based on radar range from 3 to 6
inches. Flash flooding with rock and mud slides are imminent or
already occurring.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads,
properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road
closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible
in steep terrain.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
The Hana Highway between Hana and Kipahulu.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring
within the warned area.

Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even
if they are currently dry.

Do not cross fast flowing water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn
around, don't drown.
